intro: Tylophora riparia, commonly known as the water vine or river vine, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Tylophora riparia is often found in moist, shaded habitats near rivers and streams. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional medicinal contexts.
